definition: Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
plum
surname Li
eastern bean goose/great/large
chapter/section/clause/movement (of symphony)/seal/badge/regulation/order
surname Zhang

sentences.english: Li Hongzhang was appointed to approach the imperialists and sue for peace.
sentences.chinese: 李鸿章被委派向帝国主义求和。

sentences.english: In the bedroom there is a memorial tablet of him.
sentences.chinese: 寝室内供有李鸿章灵位。

sentences.english: Actually this is a joint tomb both for Li and his wife.
sentences.chinese: 墓冢为李鸿章与赵氏夫人的合葬墓。

sentences.english: In Qing Dynasty Government, Li Hongzhang is the main leader and practitioner of the construction of coast defense.
sentences.chinese: 李鸿章是清政府海防建设的主要领导人和实践者。

sentences.english: In this hall, I'll tell you something about Li Hongzhang's Handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 在这个展厅，将向大家介绍有关李鸿章的书法作品。

sentences.english: Different factions of Christianity, Li is also due to send to another.
sentences.chinese: 对基督教的不同派别，李鸿章也因派而异。

sentences.english: From that, we can see some characteristics of Li Hongzhang's diplomatism of westernization.
sentences.chinese: 这反应了李鸿章洋务外交的若干特点。

sentences.english: If you were in his shoes, what could you do?
sentences.chinese: 都说李鸿章卖国，可他又有什么能耐呢？

sentences.english: In this exhibition hall , I'll introduce you about Li's calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 在这个展厅，将向大家介绍有关李鸿章的书法作品。

sentences.english: In Li's group. there were battles between "the Zhejiang group" and "the Fujian group".
sentences.chinese: 在李鸿章幕府内部，又有“闽党”与“浙人”之争。

sentences.english: Before us is the former residence of Li Hongzhang, you come with me.
sentences.chinese: 在我们面前的就是李鸿章故居了，大家随我进来。

sentences.english: The second part explains how Li Hongzhang dealt with Vietnam issue.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，李鸿章与越南宗主权的丧失。

sentences.english: This is Li left China's most significant legacy.
sentences.chinese: 这也是李鸿章留给中国的最有意义的遗产。

sentences.english: However, they gave up the demand after repeated talks with Li Hongzhang.
sentences.chinese: 不过，在与李鸿章多次会谈后，他们放弃了这一要求。

sentences.english: Among them, Feng's influence cannot afford to underestimate.
sentences.chinese: 这其中，冯桂芬对李鸿章的影响不可低估。

sentences.english: At first the foreign powers demanded, among other things, Empress Dowager Cixi's abdication in favor of Emperor Guangxu.
sentences.chinese: 不过，在与李鸿章多次会谈后，他们放弃了这一要求。

definition: Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
the Qing court (as government of China)
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
Ding Ruchang (1836-1895), commander of the Qing North China Navy
Shen Baozhen (1820-1879), Qing Minister of the Navy, founded Fuzhou Naval College 船政學堂|船政学堂[Chuan2 zheng4 Xue2 tang2] in 1866
Qing government (1644-1911)
ITŌ Hirobumi (1841-1909), Japanese Meiji restoration politician, prime minister on four occasions, influential in Japanese expansionism in Korea, assassinated in Harbin
north China navy (esp. the ill-fated Chinese navy in the 1895 war with Japan)
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Zhao Erxun (1844-1927), modern historian, compiled the Draft History of the Qing dynasty 清史稿
Cang Jize or Tseng Chi-tse (1839-1890), pioneer diplomat of late Qing, serve as imperial commissioner (ambassador) to UK, France and Russia
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Xue Fucheng (1838-1894), Qing official and progressive political theorist
Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
